storyInfo: It is a snowy night in Londinium. Rochelle is waiting for her father to bring home a six hundred pound settlement payment from the company.

attributes.text: The snow keeps falling, not heavy, but tacky.
No one knows how long it will keep falling.

attributes.content: Take it and go.
attributes.name: Company Representative

attributes.content: After I've counted it.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: It's six hundred pounds, what else is there to it? Did you think United Originium Industries would bother to cheat you?
attributes.name: Company Representative

attributes.content: After I've counted it.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Fine, suit yourself. Might as well.
attributes.name: Company Representative

attributes.content: Two years have passed since the railway stopped operating. You're the last one to sign the settlement.
attributes.name: Company Representative

attributes.content: Fifty-eight, fifty-nine, sixty.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: (Long sigh)
attributes.name: Company Representative

attributes.content: Finally.
attributes.name: Company Representative

attributes.content: You signed the agreement, you counted your money. Now go; you don't have anything to do with the company anymore.
attributes.name: Company Representative

attributes.content: What now? We need to go home too, you know?
attributes.name: Company Representative

attributes.content: I was just thinking.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: About what? Money? You've got all of it, not one pence short.
attributes.name: Company Representative

attributes.content: About all the things the company promised.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Movie theater, public restrooms, nursery, salt soda in the workshops. Some of them came true, others didn't.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: But I used to think that what was there wouldn't change.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Whatever you want to think about, do it at home. Get out of here.
attributes.name: Company Representative

attributes.content: What did the company promise you?
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Just. Get. Out.
attributes.name: Company Representative

attributes.content: Half of the street lamps have gone out due to disrepair, while the rest continue to shine dimly, painting the snowy night over the commercial sector a shade of orange and yellow.
Hold it.
The worker pretends not to hear and keeps walking, until he finds a knife pressed against his abdomen.
Money.
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: Don't have any.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: I know you just got a bunch. Hand it over.
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: Don't dawdle.
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: Mechanical division? Which line?
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: How did you know—
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: —Screw that, no questions. Hand over money if you don't want to get hurt.
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: What's going on? I could lend you the money, if you're really in a bind.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: You think I didn't try to borrow? Who would lend a sick man money in these times?
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: And did you think I could pay it back, even if you lent it to me?
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: I can wait—
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Shut up!
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: I'll count to three. Make up your mind, whether you want your money or your life.
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: One... Two...
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: ...Three!
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: I've counted to three! Don't make me do this!
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: My lungs are already rotten! I don't have anything to lose! I'll really do it!
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: Hand the money over!
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: Now!!
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: Getting no reaction from the worker, the robber presses the knife further forward, cutting open the worker's clothes.
He feels the sensation of cutting open something, and instinctively pulls the knife back, as though shocked by electricity.
You—
attributes.name: Robber

attributes.content: Before the robber can finish, the worker takes out the flimsy envelope and hands it over his shoulder.

The robber grabs the envelope with trembling hands, looking like a man pardoned on the eve of his execution. By the time the worker turns around, the robber has vanished into the night, along with the money.
Six hundred pounds.
The worker stands there for a while, then walks over to the side of the road. He searches his pockets and finds a cigarette, lighting it with his last match.
He breathes the smoke in deeply and squats down like a drunkard.
A single speck of red light flickers in the night.
I'm back, Rochelle.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Rochelle?
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Rochelle Rockwell!
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Where did she go? It's dark, and it's snowing. I've got to look for her—
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: ...Dad.
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: Why so late?
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: The neighbors were talking...
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: They say you've been robbed.
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: Is it true?
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: Her father nods.
I went to the place they were talking about, but there was no one there.
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: Who robbed you?
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: Thieves from other districts don't bother to come here. It must have been someone from the light industry district.
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: He even knew you were getting your settlement money today!
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: I'll catch that thief—
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: Let it go, Rochelle.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Let it go?
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: I had a few words with him. He had no choice.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Dad!
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: We would have lent him the money if he asked properly. He didn't have to rob you!
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: If he was any bolder, you would have—
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: He wouldn't have done it.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: If he had the guts, he would have hit me over the head with a hammer, like that guy a few months ago.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Rochelle shivers.
He was sick and desperate, and there was no one who would lend him money.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: It was just a moment of weakness. We're all in the same boat. When things get better...
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Will they?
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: They will.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Remember how the boys in the mechanical division made you an operational drone out of spare material for your birthday, a few years ago?
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Of course I remember.
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: It's not just mechanical. We're all family here in the light industry district.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: He'll pay it back.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: What's that? You don't believe your dad?
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: It's not that... Mrs. Clark came to ask for some food in the afternoon because they had ran out.
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: She has five kids...
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: I thought you would come back with the settlement money, so I gave them a whole baguette.
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: The two are silent.
The old house does an adequate enough job of keeping out the wind and cold, though the rattling of the windows is a constant reminder of the snow and wind outside.
I'll ask Mrs. Clark if they had any leftovers—
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: Don't, not with the snowstorm outside.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: I'll go out again tomorrow and see if there are any factories still looking for a stoker. If that doesn't work out, there are always places looking for laborers.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: But your back...
attributes.name: Rochelle

attributes.content: Who doesn't have some aches and pains around here? I'm one of the lucky ones.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Go to bed. Don't worry about me.
attributes.name: Haggard Worker

attributes.content: Years Later...
I've got another wounded here, Rockrock!
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: Coming—Mr. Robertson?!
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Can you stand, Mr. Robertson?
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: Keep an eye on him while I fetch a stretcher, Rockrock.
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: Did you see any other wounded, Mr. Robertson?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Mr. Robertson?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: Alright. Don't talk; just hang on. The stretcher will be here soon.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: I found out why the Sarkaz were beating up people in broad daylight.
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: What's going on?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: They imposed a ban on working in the light industry district.
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: A ban on working?!
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: All employment relationships outside factories under their control have been banned.
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: So they're forcing people into their factories and starving those who don't want to work for them?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Exactly.
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: These people were beaten because the Sarkaz found out they were doing jobs for non-Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: What about the old, the sick, the invalid?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Did you think they care?
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: Those bastards...
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Deep breath)
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Go and check on those whose conditions are less serious. We should have enough medicine, as long as we ration properly.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: I'll take care of Mr. Robertson. He's... not in good shape.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: It's time your medicine, Mr. Robertson.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Can you sit up?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Mr. Robertson?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Mr. Robertson, it's time for your med—
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Hey, you didn't take your meds for the morning!
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Why... take care of me...
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: We care for all the workers of Londinium.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Plus, Dad said we're all family here in the light industry district.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: And you were part of the railway's mechanical divi—
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Rockrock did not see Robertson grab his sheets.
...else.
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: What did you say?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Someone... else.
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: Someone else?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Did you want someone else to care for you?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Nods)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: I'll get someone else. But make sure you take your medicine, alright?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Closes eyes)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: Mr. Robertson!
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Slight nod)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: How are the injured, Rockrock?
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: They're recovering well. We can send them home today.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Once we do that, it'll be time for us to move.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: ...Yeah.
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: Robertson has been banging on his bed, by the way.
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: He keeps shaking his head, whether it's water, food or medicine that I'm bringing him. It's not toilet stuff either. He's too ill to speak, but he won't stop banging.
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: I think he wants you.
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Member

attributes.content: I'll be right there!
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Rockrock walks into the tent and sees Robertson still banging on the bedplate weakly.
He only stops once he opens his eyes and sees Rockrock.
You were asking for me, Mr. Robertson?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: It's alright. I'm here.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Slaps the bed lightly)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: You want me to sit by your side?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Made from several wooden planks, the makeshift bed would not have fit a bigger man.
Rockrock tries to find a space by the side of the bed, but finds only hard planks.
I'm here, Mr. Robertson.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: I heard you've been taking your medicine on time.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: That's good. It'll help you recover...
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: The sounds that Robertson makes form no coherent words, but the meaning is clear.
You're right, why talk about that?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: How about we discuss the past?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: When Dad was still around, he used to say that the railway was the lifeblood of the light industry district.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Raw materials come into the district by the railway, into the factories and workshops, and the finished products are transported out of the district to the rest of Londinium and Victoria.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: The goods are the blood that flows in the vessels, while railway workers are the... they're the—
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: The cells that form the railway.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: The cells have to work together for blood to flow unhindered, and the cells in turn get their nutrition from the bloodflow.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: I thought about it, and said that the rumbling that the train makes is the pulse of the light industry district.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Gasps)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: Dad thought a bit and said it was a good analogy.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: After that, the trains didn't seem so noisy at all when they rolled by. Instead, they were like my own heartbeat, calming me down when I listened to it.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Rumble, rumble...
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Rockrock emulates the sound of a train, while Robertson listens.
Then the factories began shutting down, one by one, and the railway went out of operation...
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Gasps)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: Mr. Robertson!?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Sorry, I just kept going...
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Let's talk about happier things.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Look!
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: This is my drone. Its name is Rock-11.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: It's my 11th drone, I started with Rock-1.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: The captain assembled it from a motley collection of parts, so it's not as good as what you get in the shops, but I had input in it as well, and the drones have been a big help.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: The Sarkaz would've caught us if not for them.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: It's all thanks to you, and Dad's colleagues in the mechanical division.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Breathes raggedly)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: Do you remember how the boys in the mechanical division made a drone for me out of spare parts for my birthday? You were the one who made the core power plant.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: I loved it. It couldn't fly very high, but I would hover it at home whenever I had time.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: I would look at the spinning rotor, and dream about building bigger and better drones when I grew up.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: That way, dad wouldn't have to watch the boilers night and day, and you wouldn't have to climb up and down all over the place when fixing stuff.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Everyone would live together happily, grabbing a round of beers together after work—
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Mumbles)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: Mr. Robertson?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Robertson's coughing interrupts her.
Rockrock sees that his eyes have become wet.
Let's not talk about that! I—
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Robertson tries to speak again, but is once again interrupted by violent coughing.
When the coughing finally stops, Robertson raises the hand that he used to bang on the bed and reaches into his shirt.
After some searching, he takes out a small plastic bag filled with money.
Money...?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: For me?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Nods)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: I can't possibly accept this, Mr. Robertson!
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Slaps the bed)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: No, I really can't.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: I could keep it safe until we find your family—
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Shakes head frantically)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Robertson gazes at Rockrock with pleading eyes, but balks at her determination.
He gives up.
He wants to sigh, but he cannot.
He lets out his breath, and reaches into his shirt again, taking out a stained envelope.
Envelope... a letter?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Sure, I'll deliver it. But the money—
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: (Bangs on the bed)
attributes.name: Robertson

attributes.content: That's not what you mean?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Rockrock turns the envelope over. The writing on it has long become faded from being soaked in sweat:
Rockwell settlement, 600 pounds.
Rockrock's eyes open wide.
Robertson pulls open the bag with his last remaining strength, spraying the contents all over the floor.
Ten-pound notes, five-pound notes, one-pound notes, even coins.
No settlement money would have been issued this way. It was money saved up, pence after pence.
It was what Robertson got himself beat up by the Sarkaz for.
...Mr. Robertson?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: There is no response.
As befitting of a laborer, Robertson died silently, having used the last bit of strength in his body.
Another morning comes to the aging light industry district.
The effect of the Sarkaz work ban can be seen in the crowds of workers headed towards the factories in the dim light of dawn.
The Sarkaz sent people to keep an eye on them at first.
But they soon realized that they were like the walking dead, completely silent on their way to work. They never cross the line, even if no one is watching.
The Sarkaz have stopped sending people to monitor the workers, freeing up the manpower to deal with resistance to their rule in other districts.
Poverty and hunger make the best overseers.
What's... that?
attributes.name: Silent Worker

attributes.content: ...A drone?
attributes.name: Aging Worker

attributes.content: A patchwork drone flies towards them.
Its bay doors open as it flies over their heads, dropping several bills.
Money?
attributes.name: Aging Worker

attributes.content: The drone glides over the workers' heads, dropping bills and coins over them like a bizarre snow.
It was equal to the amount of settlement money that a laborer could get after working half his life.
Six hundred pounds.
Search the place!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Overseer

attributes.content: We got the location of their hideout just this morning! They can't have gotten away so quickly!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Overseer

attributes.content: Sir, there's no one here. They didn't even leave behind anything, except this.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: A box of parts? Just on the table like that?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Overseer

attributes.content: Shoot a bolt into it. See if there's a trap.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Overseer

attributes.content: Yes, sir!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: Sounds like an empty box, sir!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: Open it!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Overseer

attributes.content: The Sarkaz opens the lid of the box carefully.
There is no bomb, no poison, not even a dagger for demonstration.
Inside the box is an old envelope that has been rolled into a ball.
The overseer spreads it out. There is nothing in the envelope; a piece of it has been cut away neatly.
Still unconvinced, the overseer raises it against the dim light and examines it for a while.
Other than the old stains, there are only a few teardrop marks on it.
Years Later...
Huh? It's not the first time you've handed out money?
attributes.name: Joyful Worker

attributes.content: Yeah, I don't remember how many times I've handed out extra money. It's not like I have any use for it.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Really? Well then, I'll, er, help myself. Thanks.
attributes.name: Joyful Worker

attributes.content: You're welcome.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: But that's a strange habit. Why did you start doing it? When was the first time you gave someone money?
attributes.name: Joyful Worker

attributes.content: The first time?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: It was just after the Self-Salvation Corps was formed. I helped an old colleague of my dad's—
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Rockrock looks up at the lead-grey sky, thinking about where to begin.
She catches a glimpse of a new building by the roadside, one that feels rather out of place with the decrepit scenery around it. At the top of the building is a bright neon sign:
'United Originium Industries Londinium Industrial Revival Headquarters'
